phases.title: Advanced Technical Skills
phases.target: Design a system for millions of users

projects.title: URL Shortener Service
projects.description: Build a scalable URL shortening service like bit.ly with analytics, rate limiting, and caching
projects.shortDescription: Scalable URL shortener with analytics and caching
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a production-ready URL shortening service that handles millions of requests. This project covers REST API design, database schema optimization, caching strategies with Redis, and basic analytics. Perfect for demonstrating system design thinking in interviews.

implementationSteps.title: Design the System Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Start by sketching the high-level architecture. Identify components: API server, PostgreSQL/MySQL database, Redis cache, and analytics service. Define the URL shortening algorithm using Base62 encoding (a-z, A-Z, 0-9) to convert auto-incremented IDs to short codes. Plan for 7-character codes giving you 3.5 trillion unique URLs.

implementationSteps.title: Set Up Database Schema & API
implementationSteps.description: Create the URLs table with columns: id (bigint), short_code (varchar, indexed), original_url (text), created_at, expires_at, click_count. Build REST endpoints: POST /shorten (create), GET /:code (redirect), GET /stats/:code (analytics). Use proper HTTP status codes (201, 301, 404).

implementationSteps.title: Implement Caching & Rate Limiting
implementationSteps.description: Add Redis caching for hot URLs - cache the mapping of short_code to original_url with TTL. Implement rate limiting using Redis INCR with expiry (e.g., 100 requests/minute per IP). Add middleware to check rate limits before processing requests.

implementationSteps.title: Add Analytics & Click Tracking
implementationSteps.description: Track clicks asynchronously using a message queue (Redis pub/sub or RabbitMQ). Store analytics: timestamp, referrer, user-agent, country (via IP geolocation). Build an analytics dashboard showing clicks over time, top referrers, and geographic distribution.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy & Document
implementationSteps.description: Containerize with Docker and deploy to AWS/GCP. Set up CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions. Write comprehensive API documentation using Swagger/OpenAPI. Add health check endpoints and basic monitoring. Create a README with architecture diagrams and setup instructions.

projects.title: Real-time Notification System
projects.description: Build a multi-channel notification service supporting push, email, SMS with WebSocket delivery
projects.shortDescription: Multi-channel notifications with real-time WebSocket delivery
projects.fullDescription: Create a scalable notification system that delivers messages across multiple channels (in-app, email, SMS, push). Implement real-time delivery using WebSockets, async processing with message queues, and user preference management. This project demonstrates event-driven architecture and handling distributed systems challenges.

implementationSteps.title: Design Event-Driven Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Map out the system: API Gateway receives notification requests, publishes to message queue (RabbitMQ/Kafka). Worker services consume messages and deliver to respective channels. Design notification schema: recipient_id, channel, template_id, payload, priority, scheduled_at. Plan for at-least-once delivery with idempotency keys.

implementationSteps.title: Build Core API & Queue System
implementationSteps.description: Create REST API: POST /notifications (send), GET /notifications/:userId (history), PUT /preferences/:userId (channel preferences). Set up RabbitMQ with exchanges for different priority levels (high/normal/low). Implement dead-letter queues for failed deliveries with retry logic (exponential backoff).

implementationSteps.title: Implement WebSocket Real-time Delivery
implementationSteps.description: Build WebSocket server using Socket.io or native WS. Handle connection management: authenticate users via JWT, maintain connection registry in Redis (userId -> socketId mapping). Implement heartbeat for connection health. Broadcast notifications to connected users instantly while queuing for offline users.

implementationSteps.title: Add Multi-Channel Delivery
implementationSteps.description: Create channel adapters: EmailAdapter (SendGrid/SES), SMSAdapter (Twilio), PushAdapter (FCM/APNs). Implement template engine for personalized messages (Handlebars/Mustache). Build user preference service to determine which channels to use. Add channel-specific rate limiting and cost optimization.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Tracking & Analytics
implementationSteps.description: Track delivery status: queued, sent, delivered, read, failed. For emails, implement webhook handlers for delivery/bounce/open events. Build analytics: delivery rates by channel, average delivery time, failure reasons. Create admin dashboard showing system health, queue depths, and delivery metrics.

implementationSteps.title: Scale & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Containerize all services with Docker Compose for local dev. Deploy to Kubernetes with horizontal pod autoscaling based on queue depth. Implement circuit breakers for external services (Twilio, SendGrid). Add distributed tracing (Jaeger) to debug notification flow across services.

projects.title: Distributed Task Scheduler
projects.description: Build a fault-tolerant distributed job scheduler like cron with retry logic and monitoring
projects.shortDescription: Distributed cron with fault tolerance and monitoring
projects.fullDescription: Design and build a distributed task scheduling system that handles recurring jobs, one-time tasks, and delayed execution. Implement leader election, job distribution across workers, failure handling, and a monitoring dashboard. This advanced project showcases distributed systems expertise highly valued at top companies.

implementationSteps.title: Design Distributed Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Plan the system: Scheduler service (leader) assigns jobs, Worker pool executes them, PostgreSQL stores job definitions, Redis for distributed locking and coordination. Design job schema: id, name, cron_expression, handler, payload, next_run_at, status, retry_count, max_retries. Support job types: recurring (cron), one-time, delayed.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Job Storage & Cron Parser
implementationSteps.description: Build job CRUD API: create, update, pause, resume, delete jobs. Implement cron expression parser supporting standard format (minute, hour, day, month, weekday) plus extensions like @hourly, @daily. Calculate next_run_at based on cron expression. Use database transactions to ensure job state consistency.

implementationSteps.title: Build Leader Election & Job Assignment
implementationSteps.description: Implement leader election using Redis SETNX with TTL (or use etcd/Consul for production). Leader responsibilities: poll for due jobs, assign to available workers, handle worker failures. Use Redis sorted sets for efficient job polling (score = next_run_at). Implement work-stealing for load balancing across workers.

implementationSteps.title: Create Worker Pool & Execution Engine
implementationSteps.description: Build worker service that registers with scheduler, pulls assigned jobs, executes handlers. Implement job isolation: each job runs with timeout, resource limits. Add execution hooks: before_execute, after_execute, on_failure. Track execution metrics: duration, memory usage, CPU. Workers send heartbeats; missed heartbeats trigger job reassignment.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Fault Tolerance & Retry
implementationSteps.description: Handle failure scenarios: worker crash (reassign jobs), scheduler crash (new leader election), network partition (job deduplication with idempotency). Implement retry with exponential backoff: 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s up to max_retries. Add circuit breaker for chronically failing jobs. Dead-letter queue for manual inspection of failed jobs.

implementationSteps.title: Build Monitoring Dashboard
implementationSteps.description: Create real-time dashboard: active jobs, execution history, success/failure rates, average execution time. Add alerting for: job failures exceeding threshold, queue depth growing, worker pool unhealthy. Implement job execution logs with structured logging (JSON). Build CLI tool for job management: list, trigger, pause, inspect.

implementationSteps.title: Production Hardening & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Add authentication/authorization for API access. Implement job namespaces for multi-tenancy. Set up Prometheus metrics: jobs_executed_total, job_duration_seconds, workers_active. Deploy with Kubernetes: scheduler as StatefulSet (for stable identity), workers as Deployment with HPA. Write runbook for common operational scenarios.
